===2013=== *April 18 – [[Environment and Climate Change Canada|Environment Canada]] confirmed that an EF1 tornado touched down near the community of [[Shelburne, Ontario]], destroying a large riding stable. The path of the twister was {{convert|10|km|abbr=on}} long and around {{convert|75|m|abbr=on}} wide. No injuries were reported. This tornado represented the change from the [[Fujita scale]], to the [[Enhanced Fujita scale]] in Canada.<ref name="ehfs"/><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cp24.com/news/environment-canada-tornado-hit-shelburne-ont-1.1245177 |title=CP24 – Environment Canada: Tornado hit Shelburne, Ont. |access-date=2013-04-21 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203040105/http://www.cp24.com/news/environment-canada-tornado-hit-shelburne-ont-1.1245177 |archive-date=2013-12-03 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *May 21 – three tornadoes were confirmed in [[Central Ontario]] after strong thunderstorms moved across the region. The highest rated was an EF2, which touched down near [[Glenarm, Ontario|Glenarm]], {{convert|12|km|abbr=on}} west of [[Fenelon Falls]]. The roof of a home was torn off by the strong winds.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/environment-canada-confirms-ontarios-second-tornado-of-2013/6685/ |title=The Weather Network – EC Confirms Ontario's 2nd Tornado of 2013 |access-date=2013-05-23 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130607140535/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/environment-canada-confirms-ontarios-second-tornado-of-2013/6685 |archive-date=2013-06-07 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The other two tornadoes were rated EF0; the first touching down in the community of [[Elmvale, Ontario|Elmvale]], south of [[Midland, Ontario|Midland]], and the other near [[Springwater, Ontario|Dalston]], {{convert|12|km|abbr=on}} north of [[Barrie]]. Minor damage was reported to a barn roof and silo, and around 65 mature trees were uprooted.<ref>[http://globalnews.ca/news/588673/environment-canada-confirms-two-more-tornadoes-in-ontario/ Global News Toronto – E.C. Confirms 2 more Tornadoes in Ontario] {{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/6GtRrPJUd?url=http://globalnews.ca/news/588673/environment-canada-confirms-two-more-tornadoes-in-ontario/ |date=2013-05-26 }}</ref> *May 22 – an EF0 tornado touched down on [[Ontario Highway 401|Highway 401]] near [[Front of Yonge, Ontario#Mallorytown|Mallorytown, Ontario]]. It occurred at 10:30 pm EDT (UTC−04:00) and forcibly moved a truck. *May 29 – an EF0 tornado touched down near [[Casselman, Ontario]], and was confirmed by Environment Canada thanks to amateur video of the [[funnel cloud]] lowering. Minor wind damage was reported along a narrow path of {{convert|9|km|abbr=on}} in length. *June 1 – an EF0 tornado touched down near [[Wellington North, Ontario|Kenilworth, Ontario]], and was on the ground for around one minute. Because of the remote location, no damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/fifth-tornado-of-the-season-touches-down-in-ontario/7244/ |title=The Weather Network – Fifth tornado of season touches down in Ontario |access-date=2013-06-03 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130608002724/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/fifth-tornado-of-the-season-touches-down-in-ontario/7244 |archive-date=2013-06-08 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 1 – an EF0 tornado was confirmed in the municipality of [[Saint-Hugues, Quebec]]. It tore the door off a garage and did minor roof damage to multiple homes. *June 2 – [[Environment and Climate Change Canada|Environment Canada]] confirmed that a tornado touched down briefly near [[Maple Creek, Saskatchewan]]. No rating was given for the tornado, and no damage or injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/story/2013/06/03/sk-tornado-maple-creek-1306.html |title=CBC News – Family encounters tornado near Maple Creek, Sask. |access-date=2013-06-03 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130604131110/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/story/2013/06/03/sk-tornado-maple-creek-1306.html |archive-date=2013-06-04 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 10 – an unconfirmed tornado touched down southeast of [[Yorkton, Saskatchewan]] near the town of [[Saltcoats, Saskatchewan|Saltcoats]]. It is unknown if it did any damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/story/2013/06/10/sk-bredenbury-tornado-1306.html |title=CBC News – Tornado spotted near Bredenbury, Sask. |access-date=2013-06-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130613005512/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/story/2013/06/10/sk-bredenbury-tornado-1306.html |archive-date=2013-06-13 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 12 – a tornado was reported on the north side of [[Pigeon Lake (Alberta)|Pigeon Lake, Alberta]]. It was on the ground very briefly before it went over the lake, resulting in a [[waterspout]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://edmontonjournal.com/news/Tornado+warning+sends+people+scrambling+safety/8515249/story.html |title=Edmonton Journal – Tornado warning sends people scrambling to safety |access-date=2016-09-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130616112213/http://www.edmontonjournal.com/news/Tornado+warning+sends+people+scrambling+safety/8515249/story.html |archive-date=2013-06-16 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 16 – a low-end EF0 tornado was confirmed near [[Walden, Ontario#Beaver Lake|Beaver Lake, Ontario]], about {{convert|46|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Greater Sudbury|Sudbury]]. The tornado was confirmed based upon photographic evidence, showing a weak funnel cloud rotating and briefly reaching the ground. No damage was reported. *June 19 – an unconfirmed tornado was reported north of [[Onefour, Alberta|Onefour]], near [[Pakowki Lake]]. Multiple photos uploaded to [[Twitter]] showed funnel clouds and possible tornado on the ground. *June 28 – the ninth confirmed tornado of the season struck near the town of [[Springwater, Ontario]], about {{convert|10|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Barrie]]. It was rated as a low end EF0, and no damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://toronto.ctvnews.ca/tornado-spotted-outside-barrie-is-ontario-s-9th-twister-of-the-season-1.1352849 |title=CTV News Toronto – Tornado spotted outside Barrie |access-date=2013-07-04 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130707142104/http://toronto.ctvnews.ca/tornado-spotted-outside-barrie-is-ontario-s-9th-twister-of-the-season-1.1352849 |archive-date=2013-07-07 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 4 – a confirmed tornado touched down near [[Dollard, Saskatchewan]], about {{convert|15|km|abbr=on}} west of [[Shaunavon, Saskatchewan|Shaunavon]]. Trees were knocked over and some homes and businesses sustained damage. No injuries were reported. An unconfirmed tornado was also spotted near [[Stavely, Alberta]], related to the same storm system.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://ckom.com/story/tornado-touches-down-near-shaunavon/118881 |title=News Talk 650 – Tornado touches down near Shaunavon |access-date=2013-07-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130708101506/http://ckom.com/story/tornado-touches-down-near-shaunavon/118881 |archive-date=2013-07-08 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> *July 6 - a brief tornado was reported between [[Wroxton, Saskatchewan|Wroxton]] and [[Kamsack, Saskatchewan]].<ref>[http://ckom.com/article/186451/tornadoes-and-plough-winds-hit-southeast-sask Tornado and Plough Winds in SouthEast Saskatchewan]</ref> *July 10 – at around 6:20 pm EDT (UTC−04:00), a weak EF0 tornado touched down near [[Saint-Marc-des-Carrières, Quebec]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/weak-tornado-reported-in-saint-marc-des-carrieres-quebec/9116/ |title=The Weather Network – Weak tornado reported in Quebec |access-date=2013-07-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130715022059/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/weak-tornado-reported-in-saint-marc-des-carrieres-quebec/9116 |archive-date=2013-07-15 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 13 – the communities of [[Pipestone, Manitoba|Pipestone]] and [[Hartney, Manitoba]] were hit by two unconfirmed tornadoes in the early evening, causing damage to multiple homes. Roofs were ripped off, trees knocked over, and mobile homes and trailers were overturned. The storm also brought large hail and heavy rain, causing extensive crop damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/possible-tornado-destroys-property-uproots-trees-in-southwestern-manitoba-1.1366585 |title=CTV Winnipeg – Possible tornado destroys property, uproots trees |access-date=2013-07-18 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130718210603/http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/possible-tornado-destroys-property-uproots-trees-in-southwestern-manitoba-1.1366585 |archive-date=2013-07-18 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 13 – Environment Canada confirmed two tornadoes struck southern [[Saskatchewan]], near the communities of [[Minton, Saskatchewan|Minton]] and [[Redvers]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/story/2013/07/15/sk-severe-storms-130715.html |title=CBC News Saskatchewan – More tornadoes possible in Sask. |access-date=2013-08-09 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130825180324/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/story/2013/07/15/sk-severe-storms-130715.html |archive-date=2013-08-25 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 15 – as many as seven tornadoes touched down in parts of southern [[Saskatchewan]] after a severe line of thunderstorms swept through the province. Four tornadoes were confirmed by [[Environment and Climate Change Canada|Environment Canada]], two of them spotted close to the towns of [[Kronau, Saskatchewan|Kronau]] and [[Gray, Saskatchewan|Gray]]. The other two confirmed were spotted west and southwest of [[Yorkton]]. The three unconfirmed tornadoes were reported north of [[Humboldt, Saskatchewan|Humboldt]], near [[Rosthern]], and near [[Hague, Saskatchewan|Hague]]. No damage or injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/multiple-tornadoes-reported-in-saskatchewan/9378/ |title=The Weather Network – Seven possible tornadoes spotted in Saskatchewan |access-date=2013-07-18 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130719042825/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/multiple-tornadoes-reported-in-saskatchewan/9378 |archive-date=2013-07-19 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 18 – a strong EF0 tornado was confirmed in [[Sioux Valley First Nation]], about {{convert|50|km|abbr=on}} west of [[Brandon, Manitoba]]. It left a path {{convert|250|m|abbr=on}} wide and {{convert|7|km|abbr=on}} long. One house was damaged, and numerous trees were knocked over. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/sudbury/story/2013/07/19/sby-tornado-massey-sudbury-environment-canada.html |title=CBC News – Tornado may have caused 7km of bush damage |access-date=2013-08-30 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130828101515/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/sudbury/story/2013/07/19/sby-tornado-massey-sudbury-environment-canada.html |archive-date=2013-08-28 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 19 – a weak EF0 tornado touched down near the community of [[Teviotdale, Ontario]], just south of [[Mount Forest, Ontario|Mount Forest]]. No injuries or damage was reported.<ref name=update>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/1005951/environment-canada-updates-2013-ontario-tornado-count/ |title=Global News Toronto – Environment Canada updates 2013 Ontario tornado count |access-date=2013-12-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203232909/http://globalnews.ca/news/1005951/environment-canada-updates-2013-ontario-tornado-count/ |archive-date=2013-12-03 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 20 – an EF1 tornado touched down in the [[Grand Lake (New Brunswick)|Grand Lake, new Brunswick]] area, about {{convert|40|km|abbr=on}} east of [[Fredericton]]. The hardest hit areas included [[Whites Cove, New Brunswick|Whites Cove]], where several trees were uprooted and three barns destroyed, and [[Cambridge-Narrows]], where three more structures were destroyed including a large barn.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/story/2013/07/24/nb-tornado-grand-lake.html |title=CBC News – Tornado winds hit 175 km/h, Environment Canada determines |access-date=2013-07-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130725025940/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/story/2013/07/24/nb-tornado-grand-lake.html |archive-date=2013-07-25 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 21 – Environment Canada confirmed a tornado touched down between [[Boissevain, Manitoba|Boissevain]] and [[Deloraine, Manitoba]] in an open field. No damage was reported.<ref>[http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/tornado-confirmed-near-boissevain-1.1377578 CTV Winnipeg – Tornado confirmed near Boissevain]</ref> *July 24 – a tornado was reported on the ground near [[Okotoks, Alberta]]. *July 24 – a small tornado was confirmed near [[Morris, Manitoba]], {{convert|60|km|abbr=on}} south of [[Winnipeg]]. It was on the ground for a brief period and confined to a farmer's field. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/740584/environment-canada-confirms-tornado-south-of-winnipeg/ |title=Global News Winnipeg – Environment Canada confirms tornado south of Winnipeg |access-date=2013-07-26 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130728083846/http://globalnews.ca/news/740584/environment-canada-confirms-tornado-south-of-winnipeg/ |archive-date=2013-07-28 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 29 – Environment Canada confirmed an EF0 tornado touched down in [[Ottawa]], close to [[Orleans, Ontario]]. Most of the damage was confined to the Pine View Golf Course where it left a {{convert|100|m|abbr=on}} wide path and uprooted more than 20 trees. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/story/2013/07/30/ottawa-funnel-clouds-storm-video.html |title=CBC Ottawa – Tornado touched down in Ottawa |access-date=2013-08-02 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130802013347/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/story/2013/07/30/ottawa-funnel-clouds-storm-video.html |archive-date=2013-08-02 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> * August 1 – a low end EF0 tornado was confirmed near [[Carleton Place, Ontario]], about {{convert|45|km|abbr=on}} west of Ottawa. Environment Canada used an eye-witness account to confirm the twister. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.1310news.com/2013/08/02/environment-canada-confirms-ontarios-11th-tornado/ |title=1310 News Radio – Environment Canada confirms Ontario's 11th tornado |access-date=2013-08-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150915002151/http://www.1310news.com/2013/08/02/environment-canada-confirms-ontarios-11th-tornado/ |archive-date=2015-09-15 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 2 – Environment Canada confirmed an EF0 touched down in Magiskan Lake, north of [[Cochrane, Ontario]]. The first tornado touched down north of [[Orillia]], followed by another between [[Arthur, Ontario|Arthur]] and [[Grand Valley, Ontario|Grand Valley]]. The third twister happened near [[Minden Hills|Carnarvon]]. The strongest tornado happened {{convert|5|km|abbr=on}} north of [[Dysart et al, Ontario|Haliburton]], uprooting trees and snapping branches. An aerial survey was conducted since it was in such a remote location. No injuries or major damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/environment-canada-confirms-three-wednesday-tornadoes-including-one-near-arthur-1.1403399 |title=CTV News Kitchener – Environment Canada confirms three tornadoes |access-date=2013-08-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130811204912/http://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/environment-canada-confirms-three-wednesday-tornadoes-including-one-near-arthur-1.1403399 |archive-date=2013-08-11 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> In addition to these tornadoes, Environment Canada also added one that was previously classified as a [[waterspout]]. It happened over [[Head Lake (Kawartha Lakes)|Head Lake]], in the northern part of the [[Kawartha Lakes]] region. The waterspout was added to the 2013 tornado count because in this case, it was associated with a storm system.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/811202/three-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-ontario/ |title=Global News Toronto – Three more tornadoes confirmed in Ontario |access-date=2013-08-31 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130912000849/http://globalnews.ca/news/811202/three-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-ontario/ |archive-date=2013-09-12 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 13 – a weak EF0 tornado hit in [[Sherbrooke, Quebec]], causing roof damage to a car dealership and breaking several windows.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://ec.gc.ca/meteo-weather/default.asp?lang=En&n=5BA5EAFC-1&offset=14&toc=show |title=Environment Canada – Canada's Top Ten Weather Stories for 2013 in Quebec |access-date=2014-07-10 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140709031214/http://www.ec.gc.ca/meteo-weather/default.asp?lang=En&n=5BA5EAFC-1&offset=14&toc=show |archive-date=2014-07-09 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 16 – another small EF0 tornado touched down in the [[Cabano, Quebec]] area before moving out over [[Lake Témiscouata]] and turning into a [[waterspout]]. ===2014=== *May 13 – [[Environment and Climate Change Canada|Environment Canada]] confirmed two tornadoes touched down in [[Southern Ontario]]. The first, an EF1, touched down in the [[Mildmay, Ontario|Midlmay]] area, {{convert|100|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Kitchener, Ontario|Kitchener]]. The small twister had a {{convert|2|km|abbr=on}} path and was around {{convert|150|m|abbr=on}} wide. A house and barn sustained damage and multiple trees were snapped.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-first-tornado-of-2014-season-confirmed/27521/ |title=The Weather Network – Ontario's first tornado of 2014 season confirmed |access-date=2014-05-14 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140515065233/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-first-tornado-of-2014-season-confirmed/27521/ |archive-date=2014-05-15 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The second tornado was rated an EF0, and spotted southeast of [[Listowel, Ontario|Listowel]], near [[Conestogo Lake]]. The path was approximately {{convert|8|km|abbr=on}} long, with no significant damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://london.ctvnews.ca/second-tornado-near-listowel-confirmed-by-environment-canada-1.1835053 |title=CTV London – Second tornado near Listowel confirmed by Environment Canada |access-date=2014-05-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140527020849/http://london.ctvnews.ca/second-tornado-near-listowel-confirmed-by-environment-canada-1.1835053 |archive-date=2014-05-27 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *May 26 – a weak EF0 tornado touched down near [[Roxton Falls, Quebec]], tearing the roof from a farm building. Another tornado was confirmed near [[Laurierville, Quebec|Laurierville]] thanks to video evidence, but was not given a rating.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/quebecs-first-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/28339/ |title=The Weather Network – Quebec's first tornado of the season confirmed |access-date=2014-05-27 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140530033339/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/quebecs-first-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/28339 |archive-date=2014-05-30 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 13 – a confirmed tornado touched down northwest of [[Gleichen, Alberta]] in the early evening hours. Two funnel clouds were noticed with one briefly touching the ground. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://calgary.ctvnews.ca/alberta-s-first-tornado-of-2014-touches-down-near-gleichen-1.1868709 |title=CTV Calgary – Alberta's first tornado of 2014 touches down near Gleichen |access-date=2014-06-15 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140617031618/http://calgary.ctvnews.ca/alberta-s-first-tornado-of-2014-touches-down-near-gleichen-1.1868709 |archive-date=2014-06-17 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 17 – two tornadoes were confirmed in [[Central Ontario]], the first being a high-end EF2, which hit the town of [[Essa, Ontario|Angus]]. Around 100 homes were either destroyed or sustained damage before the twister dissipated in the south end of [[Barrie]]. A [[tornado warning]] was in effect for the area at the time, and only a few minor injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://barrie.ctvnews.ca/tornado-tears-through-angus-neighbourhood-1.1873460 |title=CTV News Barrie – Tornado tears through Angus neighbourhood |access-date=2014-06-18 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140620064310/http://barrie.ctvnews.ca/tornado-tears-through-angus-neighbourhood-1.1873460 |archive-date=2014-06-20 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The second tornado, an EF1, touched down near the [[Innisfil|Stroud]] area, and left a {{convert|750|m|abbr=on}} path of uprooted trees and destroyed a farm shed.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-fourth-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/29993/ |title=The Weather Network – Ontario's fourth tornado of the season confirmed |access-date=2014-06-21 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140622115409/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-fourth-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/29993/ |archive-date=2014-06-22 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The same system also produced two unconfirmed tornadoes, one in [[Grey County]], near [[Owen Sound Billy Bishop Regional Airport]], and another near the town of [[Hanover, Ontario|Hanover]]. *June 24 – [[Southern Ontario]] again saw two confirmed tornadoes, spawning from the same storm system. The first, an EF1, traveled {{convert|7|km|abbr=on}} from [[Orangeville, Ontario|Orangeville]] to [[Amaranth, Ontario|Amaranth]], destroying a [[recreational vehicle]] (RV) and causing damage to the roof of a house. It also downed numerous trees and snapped hydro poles.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.orangeville.com/news-story/4599030-environment-canada-confirms-tornado-landed-in-amaranth/ |title=Orangeville Banner – Environment Canada confirms tornado landed in Amaranth |access-date=2014-06-26 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180421233804/https://www.orangeville.com/news-story/4599030-environment-canada-confirms-tornado-landed-in-amaranth/ |archive-date=2018-04-21 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The second, also an EF1, happened around a half hour later in the town of [[New Tecumseth]], northeast of Orangeville. It damaged 18 properties along a {{convert|10|km|abbr=on}} path, including a horse barn where a horse perished. A house also sustained major damage to the garage where the roof was torn off. No injuries were reported from either twister.<ref>[http://barrie.ctvnews.ca/environment-canada-surveys-tornado-damage-in-new-tecumseth-1.1885441 CTV News Barrie – Environment Canada surveys tornado damage in New Tecumseth]</ref> *June 27 – a tornado briefly touched down {{convert|16|km|abbr=on}} south of [[Cremona, Alberta]], and was confirmed by Environment Canada based on multiple images of an apparent dust cloud at the base of the funnel. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornado-touches-down-in-southern-alberta/30432/ |title=The Weather Network – Tornado touches down in southern Alberta |access-date=2014-06-28 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140630044039/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornado-touches-down-in-southern-alberta/30432/ |archive-date=2014-06-30 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 29 – a tornado was confirmed near [[Wainwright, Alberta]] thanks to photo and video evidence. No damage was reported. *June 30 – a confirmed EF0 tornado touched down over [[McMurrich/Monteith|Bear Lake, Ontario]], and was caught on video by a boater. The video shows the tornado crossing the lake and then head inland, where it quickly dissipated. Only minor tree damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/1430756/seventh-tornado-of-ontario-storm-season-confirmed/ |title=Global News Toronto – Seventh tornado of Ontario's storm season confirmed |access-date=2014-07-03 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140707032901/http://globalnews.ca/news/1430756/seventh-tornado-of-ontario-storm-season-confirmed/ |archive-date=2014-07-07 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 30 – an EF0 tornado was confirmed in the [[municipality]] of [[Laforce, Quebec]], uprooting several trees.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/quebecs-second-tornado-of-the-year-confirmed/30928/ |title=The Weather Network – Quebec's second tornado of the year confirmed |access-date=2014-07-03 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140707035909/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/quebecs-second-tornado-of-the-year-confirmed/30928 |archive-date=2014-07-07 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 5 – a confirmed tornado touched down in [[Hartney, Manitoba]], {{convert|80|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Brandon, Manitoba|Brandon]]. No damage was reported and it was on the ground for under a minute.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/tornado-touches-down-in-hartney-man-saturday-evening-1.1901222 |title=CTV News Winnipeg – Tornado touches down in Hartney, Man. Saturday evening |access-date=2014-07-09 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140708014923/http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/tornado-touches-down-in-hartney-man-saturday-evening-1.1901222 |archive-date=2014-07-08 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 5 – Environment Canada confirmed six tornadoes touched down in central [[Saskatchewan]], giving ratings to two. An EF2 touched down {{convert|20|km|abbr=on}} north of [[Outlook, Saskatchewan|Outlook]], and caused extensive damage to farm buildings and trees. An EF0 was also confirmed in [[Kenaston, Saskatchewan|Kenaston]], knocking over tombstones in a cemetery and damaging trees. The other four tornadoes were not rated and were only on the ground for a brief period. They happened northwest and southwest of Kenaston, and the last two were observed {{convert|15|km|abbr=on}} north of [[Davidson, Saskatchewan|Davidson]], both being on the ground simultaneously.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/1437879/environment-canada-confirms-ef2-tornado-south-of-saskatoon/ |title=Global News Saskatoon – Environment Canada confirms EF2 tornado south of Saskatoon |access-date=2014-07-09 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140708115636/http://globalnews.ca/news/1437879/environment-canada-confirms-ef2-tornado-south-of-saskatoon/ |archive-date=2014-07-08 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 7 – a brief tornado was reported and later confirmed near [[Norwich, Ontario]], south of [[Woodstock, Ontario|Woodstock]]. Environment Canada confirmed the low end EF0 tornado thanks to photographic evidence. No injuries or damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/four-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-ontario-this-season/33096/ |title=The Weather Network – Four more tornadoes confirmed in Ontario this season |access-date=2014-07-31 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811212632/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/four-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-ontario-this-season/33096/ |archive-date=2014-08-11 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 9 – an early morning storm system spawned three tornadoes in southern [[Quebec]]. An EF1 tornado touched down near the [[Sainte-Apolline-de-Patton, Quebec|Sainte-Apolline-de-Patton]] region, damaging two homes. A second EF1 also touched down near [[Lambton, Quebec|Lambton]] with minor damage reported. The third tornado struck near [[Saint-Fabien-de-Panet, Quebec|Saint-Fabien-de-Panet]] and was rated an EF2. It caused significant tree damage to a large wooded area. Tornado warnings were in place for both areas at the time.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/two-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-quebec/31898/?cid=social_20140716_27952976 |title=The Weather Network – Two more tornadoes confirmed in Quebec |access-date=2014-07-16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140729093953/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/two-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-quebec/31898/?cid=social_20140716_27952976 |archive-date=2014-07-29 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 15 – two EF0 tornadoes were confirmed near [[North Bay, Ontario]], after strong thunderstorms moved through the area. The first was actually a [[waterspout]] over [[Lake Nipissing]], but Environment Canada included it in the tornado count since it was associated with a thunderstorm over a small body of water. The second tornado touched down just south of [[North Bay/Jack Garland Airport]]. No damage was reported with either twister.<ref name=Ontario4>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/1484925/four-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-ontario/ |title=Global News Toronto – Four more tornadoes confirmed in Ontario |access-date=2014-07-31 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140805075218/http://globalnews.ca/news/1484925/four-more-tornadoes-confirmed-in-ontario/ |archive-date=2014-08-05 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 26 – three weak tornadoes were confirmed in [[Manitoba]] according to Environment Canada. The first two touched the ground briefly near [[Waterhen Indian Reserve No. 45|Waterhen]], and the third just southeast of [[La Salle, Manitoba|La Salle]]. The tornadoes were not given a rating and there were no reports of damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornadoes-spotted-in-manitoba-more-storm-risk-today/32620/ |title=The Weather Network – Tornadoes spotted in Manitoba |access-date=2014-07-27 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140730083902/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornadoes-spotted-in-manitoba-more-storm-risk-today/32620 |archive-date=2014-07-30 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 27 – two tornadoes touched down in [[Southern Ontario]] from the result of severe thunderstorms. The first was rated an EF1 and touched down south of [[Grand Bend]], snapping hydro poles and knocking over trees. Some homes and vehicles were also damaged with one serious injury reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/environment-canada-confirms-a-tornado-touched-down-in-grand-bend-1.1936079 |title=CTV Kitchener – Environment Canada confirms tornado touches down in Grand Bend |access-date=2014-07-29 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140809053317/http://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/environment-canada-confirms-a-tornado-touched-down-in-grand-bend-1.1936079 |archive-date=2014-08-09 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The second confirmed tornado was reported by storm spotters near [[Perth East, Ontario|Millbank]], {{convert|30|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Kitchener, Ontario|Kitchener]]. Spotters described seeing swirling dust and debris at the bottom of a funnel cloud, indicating that a tornado briefly formed. The tornado was given an low EF0 rating and no damage was reported.<ref name=Ontario4/> *July 31 – an EF1 tornado hit the small community of [[Pont-Rouge, Quebec]], as confirmed by Environment Canada, causing significant damage to the roof of a house. Trees were also uprooted and shed was blown away. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://montrealgazette.com/news/Tornado+strikes+Pont+Rouge+west+Quebec+City+injuries/10082606/story.html |title=Montreal Gazette – Tornado strikes Pont-Rouge west of Quebec City; no injuries |access-date=2016-09-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140826122203/http://www.montrealgazette.com/news/Tornado+strikes+Pont+Rouge+west+Quebec+City+injuries/10082606/story.html |archive-date=2014-08-26 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 5 – Environment Canada confirmed a weak EF0 tornado touched down in [[Asubpeeschoseewagong First Nation]] (Grassy Narrows First Nation) community in [[Northwestern Ontario]], causing damage to the roof of one house. The tornado was confirmed thanks to eyewitness accounts, archived radar data and photographic evidence.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-thirteenth-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/33590/ |title=The Weather Network – Ontario's thirteenth tornado of the season confirmed |access-date=2014-08-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140810011054/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-thirteenth-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/33590/ |archive-date=2014-08-10 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 19 – two EF0 tornadoes were confirmed by Environment Canada in [[Southwestern Ontario]]. The first touched down in [[Windsor, Ontario|Windsor]] and left a damage path {{convert|1.5|km|abbr=on}} long and {{convert|150|m|abbr=on}} wide. A number of trees were snapped and a gazebo was destroyed. The second tornado occurred northeast of [[Harrow, Ontario|Harrow]] where a barn lost part of its roof.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/two-tornadoes-confirmed-in-windsor-ont/34527/ |title=The Weather Network – Two tornadoes confirmed in Windsor Ontario |access-date=2014-08-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140826114444/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/two-tornadoes-confirmed-in-windsor-ont/34527/ |archive-date=2014-08-26 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 20 – a short lived EF0 tornado was confirmed near the town of [[Erin, Ontario]] thanks to video evidence. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-sixteenth-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/35314/ |title=The Weather Network – Ontario's sixteenth tornado of the season confirmed |access-date=2014-09-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140907124625/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/ontarios-sixteenth-tornado-of-the-season-confirmed/35314 |archive-date=2014-09-07 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *September 5 – two tornadoes were confirmed in [[Central Ontario]] after severe weather swept through the area. The first, an low-end EF0, hit [[Christian Island]] causing tree damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://barrie.ctvnews.ca/tornado-confirmed-on-christian-island-1.2015664 |title=CTV News Barrie – Tornado confirmed on Christian Island |access-date=2014-09-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140926033038/http://barrie.ctvnews.ca/tornado-confirmed-on-christian-island-1.2015664 |archive-date=2014-09-26 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The second tornado was rated an EF1 and touched down in the town of [[Ramara|Udney]], about {{convert|20|km|abbr=on}} east of [[Orillia]]. Six farms, three houses and a community centre storage building were damaged. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.orilliapacket.com/2014/09/09/tracking-udneys-twister |title=Orrilia Packet and Times – Tracking Udney's Twister |access-date=2014-09-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160116011208/http://www.orilliapacket.com/2014/09/09/tracking-udneys-twister |archive-date=2016-01-16 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *September 10 – an EF1 tornado was confirmed near Port Alma, Ontario, {{convert|35|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Chatham-Kent]]. Multiple trees were snapped along a 900-metre path.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://twitter.com/dave_sills/status/661259725418405888 |title=Twitter – Dave Sills |access-date=2016-04-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171018000154/https://twitter.com/dave_sills/status/661259725418405888 |archive-date=2017-10-18 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *October 6 – a low-end EF1 tornado hit the village of [[Sheffield, Ontario]], about {{convert|35|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Hamilton, Ontario|Hamilton]]. It damaged homes along a {{convert|1.5|km|abbr=on}} long path, ripping shingles from roofs and destroying a [[travel trailer]]. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.thespec.com/news-story/4904008-environment-canada-confirms-tornado-hit-sheffield/ |title=The Hamilton Spectator – Environment Canada confirms tornado hit Sheffield |access-date=2014-10-09 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141010024046/http://www.thespec.com/news-story/4904008-environment-canada-confirms-tornado-hit-sheffield/ |archive-date=2014-10-10 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref>

===2015===
*May 30 – an EF1 tornado briefly touched down near the community of [[Middlesex Centre|Bryanston, Ontario]], {{convert|18|km|abbr=on}} northeast of [[London, Ontario|London]], ripping the roof off a barn. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://london.ctvnews.ca/first-tornado-of-the-year-confirmed-northeast-of-london-1.2406812 |title=CTV London – First tornado of the year confirmed northeast of London |access-date=2015-06-04 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150801181248/http://london.ctvnews.ca/first-tornado-of-the-year-confirmed-northeast-of-london-1.2406812 |archive-date=2015-08-01 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 4 – [[Environment and Climate Change Canada|Environment Canada]] confirmed an EF0 [[landspout|landspout tornado]] touched down {{convert|5|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Airdrie, Alberta]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.calgarysun.com/2015/06/05/thursdays-stormy-skies-spawn-small-landspout-tornado-northwest-of-airdrie |title=Calgary Sun – Thursday's stormy skies spawn small landspout tornado northwest of Airdrie |access-date=2015-06-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150816232935/http://www.calgarysun.com/2015/06/05/thursdays-stormy-skies-spawn-small-landspout-tornado-northwest-of-airdrie |archive-date=2015-08-16 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 22 – an EF0 tornado was confirmed near [[Holmesville, Ontario]], {{convert|15|km|abbr=on}} southeast of [[Goderich, Ontario|Goderich]]. A photo posted to [[Twitter]] from a [[storm chasing|storm chaser]] in the area showed what appeared to be a tornado on the ground. Environment Canada cited "there was minor damage reported in the area, as well as evidence that objects "moved in different directions"". No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/weak-tornado-touched-down-in-huron-county-environment-canada-says-1.2466710 |title=CTV Kitchener – Weak tornado touched down in Huron County, Environment Canada says |access-date=2015-07-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150714051148/http://kitchener.ctvnews.ca/weak-tornado-touched-down-in-huron-county-environment-canada-says-1.2466710 |archive-date=2015-07-14 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 21 – an unrated tornado was confirmed by Environment Canada near [[Cochrane, Alberta]]. Funnel cloud advisories had been in effect for much of [[Southern Alberta]] throughout the day.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://calgaryherald.com/news/local-news/environment-canada-issues-funnel-cloud-advisory-for-calgary-and-area |title=Calgary Herald – Environment Canada lifts funnel cloud advisory for Calgary and area |access-date=2016-04-14 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160410042802/http://calgaryherald.com/news/local-news/environment-canada-issues-funnel-cloud-advisory-for-calgary-and-area |archive-date=2016-04-10 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 24 – two EF0 landspout tornadoes were confirmed in [[southern Manitoba]] near the town of [[Manitou, Manitoba|Manitou]]. The first touched down {{convert|3|km|abbr=on}} east of the town, and within 30 minutes a second was spotted {{convert|7|km|abbr=on}} northwest. Damage was localized to field crops and no injuries were reported. Parts of the province had been under [[tornado warning]]s at the time.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornado-rips-through-s-manitoba-see-it-here/53325/ |title=The Weather Network – Two tornadoes touch down in Southern Manitoba. |access-date=2015-06-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150625232817/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornado-rips-through-s-manitoba-see-it-here/53325/ |archive-date=2015-06-25 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 12 – a unrated, small rope-like tornado touched down south of [[Ninette, Manitoba]], about {{convert|200|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Winnipeg]]. Storm spotters reported it was on the ground for 3 to 5 minutes. No damage or injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/brief-tornado-touchdown-in-southwestern-manitoba-1.2466064 |title=CTV Winnipeg – Brief tornado touchdown in southwestern Manitoba |access-date=2015-07-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150714031034/http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/brief-tornado-touchdown-in-southwestern-manitoba-1.2466064 |archive-date=2015-07-14 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 18 – an unrated landspout tornado was confirmed by Environment Canada near [[Winnipeg Beach, Manitoba]], {{convert|56|km|abbr=on}} north of [[Winnipeg]]. The weak tornado was on land for approximately 20–30 minutes. There were no reports of injuries or damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/environment-canada-confirms-tornado-touchdown-1.2475802 |title=CTV Winnipeg – Environment Canada confirms tornado touchdown |access-date=2015-07-20 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150721004410/http://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/environment-canada-confirms-tornado-touchdown-1.2475802 |archive-date=2015-07-21 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 22 – a tornado was confirmed near the village of [[Priddis, Alberta]], {{convert|40|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Calgary]]. Video evidence helped Environment Canada to confirm the brief touchdown, but they did not give it a rating. There were no reports of major damage. Another unrated tornado was also confirmed near [[Gleichen, Alberta|Gleichen]], causing no damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/tornado-touchdown-confirmed-southwest-of-calgary-1.2481248?hootPostID=a051d97d6b19adab7426cf552281c1fd |title=CTV Calgary – Tornado touchdown confirmed southwest of Calgary |access-date=2015-07-22 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150724020931/http://www.ctvnews.ca/canada/tornado-touchdown-confirmed-southwest-of-calgary-1.2481248?hootPostID=a051d97d6b19adab7426cf552281c1fd |archive-date=2015-07-24 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 27 – a high end EF2 tornado was confirmed near [[Tilston, Manitoba]], close to the Manitoba–Saskatchewan and [[Canada–United States border|Canada–US]] borders. The large tornado was up to a kilometre wide at one point, and [[Multiple-vortex tornado|multiple vortices]] were seen swirling in fields. It severely damaged a farm, overturning trucks and destroying outbuildings and grain bins. A bridge was also damaged on [[Manitoba Provincial Road 256|Provincial Road 256]], lifting asphalt from the road. Most significantly it was on the ground for 2.5 to 3 hours, making it the longest lived tornado documented in Canada and possibly one of the longest lived in the world. There were no reports of injuries.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.rcinet.ca/en/2015/07/28/tornado-called-incredible-by-officials/ |title=Radio Canada International – Tornado called ‘incredible’ by officials |access-date=2015-07-30 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924085117/http://www.rcinet.ca/en/2015/07/28/tornado-called-incredible-by-officials/ |archive-date=2015-09-24 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 2 – four tornadoes were confirmed in [[Southern Ontario]] after severe storms swept through the southwestern and central parts of the province. An EF2 touched down near [[Teviotdale, Ontario|Teviotdale]], {{convert|55|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Guelph]]. It destroyed a barn, and severely damaged two houses. Five [[Ontario Provincial Police]] (OPP) cruisers also sustained damage. Another EF2 was confirmed in Lebanon, {{convert|20|km|abbr=on}} southeast of [[Listowel, Ontario|Listowel]], damaging barns and silos, and lifting a sailboat into a line of trees. It left a damage path approximately {{convert|5|km|abbr=on}} long.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://london.ctvnews.ca/weekend-storm-spawned-third-tornado-environment-canada-1.2506892 |title=CTV News London – Weekend storm spawned third tornado: Environment Canada |access-date=2015-08-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150814150032/http://london.ctvnews.ca/weekend-storm-spawned-third-tornado-environment-canada-1.2506892 |archive-date=2015-08-14 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> A third tornado, rated an EF1, touched down near [[East Garafraxa|Marsville]], {{convert|15|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Orangeville, Ontario|Orangeville]]. It left a damage path {{convert|2|km|abbr=on}} long, snapping trees and overturning a feed barn. Another EF1 was confirmed in the [[Millgrove, Ontario|Millgrove]] area, north of [[Hamilton, Ontario|Hamilton]], leaving a small damage path with damage to roofs and trees. Luckily no injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/second-tornado-confirmed-from-sundays-strong-storms/55309/ |title=The Weather Network – Second tornado confirmed from Sunday's strong storms |access-date=2015-08-05 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150807161407/http://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/second-tornado-confirmed-from-sundays-strong-storms/55309/ |archive-date=2015-08-07 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 3 – an EF0 tornado was confirmed in the [[Matapedia Valley]], Quebec, near the [[Types of municipalities in Quebec|parish municipality]] of [[Saint-Zénon-du-Lac-Humqui, Quebec|Saint-Zénon-du-Lac-Humqui]]. It caused damage to a farm, completely destroying a warehouse and left a damage path of {{convert|2|km|abbr=on}} long and {{convert|60|ft|abbr=on|order=flip}} wide in a nearby wooded area. No injuries were reported. *August 5 – Alberta, a tornado was reported on the ground by storm spotters near [[Langdon, Alberta|Langdon]], about {{convert|35|km|abbr=on}} east of [[Calgary]]. No damage was reported, but Environment Canada later confirmed it as an unrated tornado.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.highriveronline.com/local/31575-tornado-spotted-near-langdon-warning-issued |title=High River Online – Tornado Spotted Near Langdon, Warning Issued |access-date=2015-08-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924041357/http://www.highriveronline.com/local/31575-tornado-spotted-near-langdon-warning-issued |archive-date=2015-09-24 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 6 – a tornado was confirmed near [[Foremost, Alberta]], {{convert|115|km|abbr=on}} southeast of [[Lethbridge]]. There were no reports of damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/tornado-touches-down-near-foremost-in-southeastern-alberta-1.3182017 |title=CBC News Calgary – Tornado touches down near Foremost in southeastern Alberta |access-date=2015-08-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150807183656/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/tornado-touches-down-near-foremost-in-southeastern-alberta-1.3182017 |archive-date=2015-08-07 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 7 – a unrated tornado was confirmed near [[Anola, Manitoba]], about {{convert|39|km|abbr=on}} east of [[Winnipeg]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/tornado-touches-down-near-anola-1.3182619 |title=CBC News Manitoba – Tornado touches down near Anola |access-date=2015-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150811054624/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/tornado-touches-down-near-anola-1.3182619 |archive-date=2015-08-11 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 19 – an EF1 tornado touched down in a wooded area northeast of [[Kapuskasing, Ontario]], leaving a narrow swath of tree damage {{convert|150|m|abbr=on}} wide and {{convert|3.5|km|abbr=on}} long. Environment Canada was notified of the tree damage thanks to a pilot flying over the area.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://highwaysandhailstones.com/tornado-map/august-19-2015-kapuskasing-ef1/ |title=Highways & Hailstones – Tornado Near Kapuskasing |access-date=2016-04-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160329160507/http://highwaysandhailstones.com/tornado-map/august-19-2015-kapuskasing-ef1/ |archive-date=2016-03-29 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *September 13 – an unrated tornado was confirmed near [[Didsbury, Alberta]] causing no damage. *October 15 – an EF0 tornado was confirmed in [[Nickel Centre#Coniston|Coniston, Ontario]], just east of [[Greater Sudbury|Sudbury]] thanks to video evidence and eyewitness reports. Multiple trees were snapped, some homes sustained roof damage and a trampoline was lifted {{convert|200|ft|abbr=on}} in the air. No injuries were reported.<ref>[https://twitter.com/dave_sills/status/667813647222071296 Dave Sills Twitter – Two more 2015 ON tornadoes confirmed]</ref>

*April 11 - an EF1 tornado was confirmed near [[Thamesford, Ontario]], northeast of [[London, Ontario|London]], damaging a barn and knocking over utility poles along a {{convert|11|km|abbr=on}} path. A [[meteorologist]] with Environment Canada said the touchdown was brief and no one was injured.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.edmontonsun.com/2017/07/01/tornado-touches-down-near-sangudo-lighting-strikes-reported-across-alberta |title=Edmonton Sun - Tornado touches down near Sangudo, lighting strikes reported across Alberta |access-date=2017-07-06 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170702080613/http://www.edmontonsun.com/2017/07/01/tornado-touches-down-near-sangudo-lighting-strikes-reported-across-alberta |archive-date=2017-07-02 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 5 - an EF2 tornado touched down in [[Alida, Saskatchewan]], severely damaging a house. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/3579173/tornado-touches-down-in-southeast-saskatchewan/ |title=Global News - EF-2 tornado severely damages home in southeast Saskatchewan |access-date=2017-07-07 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170708131604/http://globalnews.ca/news/3579173/tornado-touches-down-in-southeast-saskatchewan/ |archive-date=2017-07-08 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 6 - an EF2 tornado was confirmed in [[Quetico Provincial Park]] in northwestern [[Ontario]] thanks to aerial reconnaissance by the Provincial Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.931theborder.ca/news/1262988824/tornado-touches-down-quetico |title=93.1 The Border - Tornado Touches Down In Quetico |access-date=2017-07-15 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180421233036/http://www.931theborder.ca/news/1262988824/tornado-touches-down-quetico |archive-date=2018-04-21 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 9 - [[Sunchild First Nation|Sunchild First Nation, Alberta]] was hit with an EF0 tornado causing no damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://edmontonjournal.com/news/local-news/severe-thunderstorm-watch-for-edmonton-and-area |title=Edmonton Journal - Tornado warning ended, severe thunderstorm watches in effect for Edmonton and central Alberta |access-date=2017-07-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170711131743/http://edmontonjournal.com/news/local-news/severe-thunderstorm-watch-for-edmonton-and-area |archive-date=2017-07-11 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 10 - a EF0 tornado was confirmed {{convert|13|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Calgary International Airport]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/3592601/tornado-confirmed-northwest-of-calgary-airport-monday/ |title=Global News - Tornado confirmed northwest of Calgary airport Monday |access-date=2017-07-13 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170712165335/http://globalnews.ca/news/3592601/tornado-confirmed-northwest-of-calgary-airport-monday/ |archive-date=2017-07-12 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 10 - an unconfirmed tornado was reported on the ground approximately {{convert|8|km|abbr=on}} west of [[Laporte, Saskatchewan]].<ref>[http://www.620ckrm.com/2017/07/11/127200/ 620 CKRM Regina - Rain, hail, high winds batter Saskatoon; unsettled weather to continue in southern & central Sask.]</ref> *July 12 - two EF0 tornadoes were confirmed in [[Ontario]], the first touching down north of [[Lucan, Ontario|Lucan]], leaving a 170 meter wide, {{convert|5|km|abbr=on}} damage path and overturning multiple camper trailers at a local storage facility.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://london.ctvnews.ca/tornado-touched-down-wednesday-in-lucan-environment-canada-1.3501572 |title=CTV London - Tornado touched down Wednesday in Lucan: Environment Canada |access-date=2017-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170813010528/http://london.ctvnews.ca/tornado-touched-down-wednesday-in-lucan-environment-canada-1.3501572 |archive-date=2017-08-13 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> The second tornado formed over [[Lake Simcoe]] as a tornadic [[waterspout]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://barrie.ctvnews.ca/large-waterspout-formed-on-lake-simcoe-near-georgina-island-1.3501783 |title=CTV Barrie - Large waterspout formed on Lake Simcoe near Georgina Island |access-date=2017-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170812212458/http://barrie.ctvnews.ca/large-waterspout-formed-on-lake-simcoe-near-georgina-island-1.3501783 |archive-date=2017-08-12 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 13 - Two tornadoes were confirmed in Alberta after severe weather swept through the province. The second tornado touched down near [[Athabasca, Alberta|Athabasca]] over an open field and no damage was reported. The twister was given a preliminary EF0 rating. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://globalnews.ca/news/3600854/environment-canada-confirms-2nd-tornado-touched-down-in-alberta-on-thursday/ |title=Global News - Environment Canada confirms 2nd tornado touched down in Alberta on Thursday |access-date=2017-07-15 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170715125653/http://globalnews.ca/news/3600854/environment-canada-confirms-2nd-tornado-touched-down-in-alberta-on-thursday/ |archive-date=2017-07-15 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 21 - Six tornadoes were confirmed in southern [[Saskatchewan]]; the first two touching down north of [[Lanigan, Saskatchewan|Lanigan]]. The other four touched down near the town of [[Quill Lake, Saskatchewan|Quill Lake]], near [[Fishing Lake]], near [[Jansen, Saskatchewan|Jansen]] and between [[Wapella, Saskatchewan|Wapella]] and [[Rocanville, Saskatchewan|Rocanville]]. Environment Canada has not yet rated any of these tornadoes, and no damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/four-tornadoes-confirmed-on-the-prairies-weekend-outlook/84355/ |title=The Weather Network - Four tornadoes confirmed on the Prairies |access-date=2017-07-22 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170722183650/https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/four-tornadoes-confirmed-on-the-prairies-weekend-outlook/84355/ |archive-date=2017-07-22 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 25 - an unrated tornado was confirmed near [[Dryden, Ontario]].<ref name="Quebec2017"/> *August 4 - three tornadoes were confirmed in [[Ontario|Ontario's]] [[Cottage country]] after an afternoon of severe weather. The first tornado, an EF1, touched down near the community of Utterson, leaving a {{convert|4.2|km|abbr=on}} long path, snapping numerous trees. The second, also an EF1, left a {{convert|1|km|abbr=on}} damage path on the south side of [[Huntsville, Ontario|Huntsville]] before heading out over Fairy Lake as a tornadic waterspout. Trees were snapped, docks were flipped and many cottages sustained roof damage. The third tornado was rated as an EF2 and touched down in the [[Lake of Bays]] area. It carved a {{convert|9|km|abbr=on}} path from Pell Lake to Dotty Lake, snapping numerous trees and causing structural damage to cottages. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.muskokaregion.com/community-story/7495921-breaking-further-investigation-determines-third-tornado-hit-muskoka/ |title=MuskokaRegion.com - Further investigation determines third tornado hit Muskoka |access-date=2017-08-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170811103854/https://www.muskokaregion.com/community-story/7495921-breaking-further-investigation-determines-third-tornado-hit-muskoka/ |archive-date=2017-08-11 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 5 - an EF1 tornado touched down in [[Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce|Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce, Quebec]], snapping trees and destroying buildings. The damage was contained to 4 properties in the area and no injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/tornado-hits-beauce-region-1.4237249 |title=CBC Montreal - 'Things started to fly': Roofs lifted and homes damaged after tornado hits Beauce region |access-date=2017-08-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170808010827/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/tornado-hits-beauce-region-1.4237249 |archive-date=2017-08-08 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 11 - [[Environment Canada]] confirmed two tornadoes touched down in [[Southern Ontario]]. The second was a much stronger EF2 tornado, and struck near [[Hawkesville, Ontario|Hawkesville]], approximately {{convert|20|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Waterloo, Ontario|Waterloo]]. It tore a {{convert|5|km|abbr=on}} path which damaged farm buildings and sheds, knocked heavy machinery over and snapped power poles. Luckily no injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/thunderstorm-risk-southern-ontario-heavy-rain-strong-winds-/84988 |title=The Weather Network - Two tornadoes confirmed in southern Ontario |access-date=2017-08-12 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170813054239/https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/thunderstorm-risk-southern-ontario-heavy-rain-strong-winds-/84988 |archive-date=2017-08-13 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 22 - an EF1 tornado touched down in [[Lachute, Quebec]], approximately {{convert|62|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Montreal, Quebec|Montreal]], destroying 20 homes and damaging over 300. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/environment-canada-lachute-tornado-1.4258451 |title=CBC Montreal - Tornado rips through Lachute, leaving up to 40 homeless |access-date=2017-08-23 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170823205836/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/environment-canada-lachute-tornado-1.4258451 |archive-date=2017-08-23 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *September 22 - an EF0 tornado touched down in Northwestern Ontario near [[Werner Lake, Ontario|Werner Lake]], approximately {{convert|80|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Kenora]], damaging a remote cabin and nearby trees. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/weak-landspout-tornado-confirmed-alberta/87263 |title=The Weather Network - Weak landspout tornado confirmed in Alberta |access-date=2017-10-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171008181214/https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/weak-landspout-tornado-confirmed-alberta/87263 |archive-date=2017-10-08 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *October 15 - an EF0 tornado touched down in [[Mont-Laurier, Quebec]], approximately {{convert|240|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Montreal, Quebec|Montreal]], damaging 6 homes. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/weather-tornado-windstorm-mont-laurier-quebec-laurentians-1.4356332 |title=CBC Ottawa - Tornado damages 6 homes in Mont-Laurier, Que. |access-date=2017-10-17 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171017101757/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/weather-tornado-windstorm-mont-laurier-quebec-laurentians-1.4356332 |archive-date=2017-10-17 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref>

===2018===
*May 24 - an EF0 [[landspout]] tornado was confirmed near [[Calmar, Alberta]] causing no damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://globalnews.ca/news/4229950/wizard-lake-weather-alberta-possible-landspout-tornado-video/ |title=Global News Alberta - Alberta mom ‘shocked’ to capture possible landspout tornado on video |access-date=2018-06-16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180616233224/https://globalnews.ca/news/4229950/wizard-lake-weather-alberta-possible-landspout-tornado-video/ |archive-date=2018-06-16 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *May 24 - two [[landspout]] tornadoes were confirmed in southern [[Saskatchewan]] near [[Tyvan, Saskatchewan|Tyvan]] and [[Gerald, Saskatchewan|Gerald]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://globalnews.ca/news/4231110/environment-canada-confirms-2-landspout-tornadoes-in-southern-sask/ |title=Global News Saskatchewan - Environment Canada confirms 2 landspout tornadoes in southern Sask. |access-date=2018-05-26 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180526042818/https://globalnews.ca/news/4231110/environment-canada-confirms-2-landspout-tornadoes-in-southern-sask/ |archive-date=2018-05-26 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 13 - two tornadoes were confirmed in Southern Ontario after strong storms swept through the province. The first, an EF2, touched down near [[Waterford, Ontario|Waterford]] and left a damage path {{convert|32|km|abbr=on}} long before dissipating near the shores of [[Lake Erie]]. Several barns were destroyed, multiple buildings sustained roof damage and trees were uprooted and sheared apart. One person sustained minor injuries. The second tornado, an EF0, briefly touched down near [[Norwich, Ontario|Norwich]] causing minimal damage.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/severe-storms-heavy-rain-hail-damage-southern-ontario-toronto-london-ottawa-power-outages-strong-winds-photos/104588 |title=The Weather Network - Ontario tornado upgraded to EF-2, second twister confirmed |access-date=2018-06-15 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180615214748/https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/severe-storms-heavy-rain-hail-damage-southern-ontario-toronto-london-ottawa-power-outages-strong-winds-photos/104588 |archive-date=2018-06-15 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 14 - an unrated tornado was confirmed by [[Environment and Climate Change Canada]] near [[Waskada, Manitoba]], approximately {{convert|330|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Winnipeg, Manitoba|Winnipeg]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/manitoba-weather-watches-1.4707418 |title=CBC Manitoba - Tornado touches down as Manitoba storm brings massive hail and power outages |access-date=2018-06-15 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180615171731/http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/manitoba-weather-watches-1.4707418 |archive-date=2018-06-15 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 23 - an EF0 [[landspout]] tornado was confirmed near [[Griffin, Saskatchewan]], {{convert|30|km|abbr=on}} east of [[Weyburn, Saskatchewan|Weyburn]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.cjme.com/2018/06/23/land-spout-tornado-spotted-near-griffin-sask/ |title=News Talk 980 CJME - Landspout tornado spotted near Griffin, Sask. |access-date=2018-06-24 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180624204628/https://www.cjme.com/2018/06/23/land-spout-tornado-spotted-near-griffin-sask/ |archive-date=2018-06-24 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *June 30 - an EF0 tornado was confirmed near [[Pauingassi First Nation]], approximately {{convert|280|km|abbr=on}} northeast of [[Winnipeg, Manitoba]], causing no damage. *July 1 - a [[waterspout]] tornado was confirmed over [[Lake Manitoba]] near [[St. Laurent, Manitoba]], approximately 80 km (50 mi) northwest of [[Winnipeg|Winnipeg, Manitoba]], causing no damage.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/canada-day-weather-winnipeg-manitoba-day-after-1.4730892|title=CBC News - Quarter-sized hail, heavy rain and winds crash Canada Day festivities in southern Manitoba|access-date=2018-08-05|language=en-US}}</ref> *July 3 - an EF0 [[landspout]] tornado was confirmed near [[Otthon, Saskatchewan]], {{convert|17|km|abbr=on}} southwest of [[Yorkton, Saskatchewan|Yorkton]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://globalnews.ca/video/4312341/weak-landspout-tornado-spotted-near-otthon-sask-on-july-3 |title=Global News Saskatchewan - Weak landspout tornado spotted near Otthon, Sask. on July 3 |access-date=2018-07-04 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180705010836/https://globalnews.ca/video/4312341/weak-landspout-tornado-spotted-near-otthon-sask-on-july-3 |archive-date=2018-07-05 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 9 - three EF0 tornadoes touched down in [[Saskatchewan]] near the towns of [[Cantuar, Saskatchewan|Cantuar]], [[Swift Current, Saskatchewan|Swift Current]] and [[Chaplin, Saskatchewan|Chaplin]], causing no damage.<ref name=2018JULY>{{Cite web |url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/prairies-severe-thunderstorms-alberta-saskatchewan-tornado-touchdowns-tennis-hail/106374 |title=The Weather Network - Saskatchewan: 9 tornadoes in 2 days, close to YEARLY total |access-date=2018-07-11 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180711203023/https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/prairies-severe-thunderstorms-alberta-saskatchewan-tornado-touchdowns-tennis-hail/106374 |archive-date=2018-07-11 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *July 10 - eight tornadoes were confirmed in southern [[Saskatchewan]]. All but two were given ratings of EF0 by [[Environment and Climate Change Canada]] (ECCC). The first occurred in the mid afternoon hours, {{convert|15|km|abbr=on}} west of [[Golden Prairie, Saskatchewan|Golden Prairie]]. The next 2 touched down near [[Val Marie, Saskatchewan|Val Marie]]. An EF-1 tornado then occurred near [[Ferland, Saskatchewan|Ferland]]. As the storm system moved east, 2 tornadoes were confirmed southwest of [[Wood Mountain, Saskatchewan|Wood Mountain]], one given an EF-2 rating. The last two touched down near [[Fife Lake, Saskatchewan|Fife Lake]] and [[Coronach, Saskatchewan|Coronach]]. <ref name=2018JULY/><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://globalnews.ca/news/4300227/sask-tornado-touchdowns-in-2018/|title=Sask. records second highest tornado count in over a decade|work=Global News|access-date=2018-09-11|language=en}}</ref> *July 22 - a tornado was confirmed northeast of [[Langenburg, Saskatchewan]], near the [[Manitoba]] provincial border. It uprooted several large trees. *July 22 - a waterspout tornado was confirmed on [[Lake of the Prairies]], near [[Roblin, Manitoba]]. No damage was reported.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/tornado-touches-down-near-roblin-1.4023455 |title=CTV Winnipeg - Tornado touches down near Roblin |access-date=2018-07-23 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180724032247/https://winnipeg.ctvnews.ca/tornado-touches-down-near-roblin-1.4023455 |archive-date=2018-07-24 |dead-url=no |df= }}</ref> *August 3 - an EF4 tornado with peak winds of 270-280 km/h touched down near [[Alonsa, Manitoba]], approximately {{convert|210|km|abbr=on}} northwest of [[Winnipeg, Manitoba|Winnipeg]]. It destroyed several homes, at least two cottages and several recreational trailers at the [[Rural Municipality of Alonsa|Margaret Bruce Beach Campground]] along an 800 metre wide path<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/alonsa-manitoba-tornado-1.4774912|title=CBC News - Alonsa, Man., tornado's path was as wide as 800 metres: Environment Canada|access-date=2018-08-05|language=en-US|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180805201106/https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/alonsa-manitoba-tornado-1.4774912|archive-date=2018-08-05|dead-url=no|df=}}</ref> before dissipating over [[Lake Manitoba]]. Two people suffered minor injuries and one fatality was confirmed, the first tornado-related fatality in Canada since the [[2011 Goderich, Ontario tornado|2011 Goderich tornado]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/fatality-reported-manitoba-tornado-alonsa/107872/?platform=hootsuite|title=The Weather Network - Manitoba tornado that killed a person upgraded to EF-4|access-date=2018-08-06}}</ref> *August 27 - a high end EF0 tornado touched down north of [[Barrie, Ontario]], tracking from [[Guthrie, Ontario|Guthrie]] to [[Oro Station, Ontario|Oro Station]] and possibly across [[Lake Simcoe]] before dissipating. It caused minimal damage to trees and buildings and snapped a {{convert|20|m|abbr=on}} communications tower in half along a {{convert|5|km|abbr=on}} path.<ref>{{cite web |first=Leeanna |last=McLean |url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornado-warnings-southern-ontario-scary-skies-ominous-clouds-barrie-orillia-collingwood-kawartha-lakes-washago-bancroft-haliburton-severe-thunderstorm-warnings-severe-weather-photos-videos/110166 |title=The Weather Network - WATCH: Tornado caught on camera in southern Ont., see it |date=August 29, 2018 |publisher=The Weather Network}}</ref> *August 29 - an EF2 tornado was confirmed in the [[Saint-Julien, Quebec]] region, approximately {{convert|170|km|abbr=on}} northeast of [[Montreal, Quebec|Montreal]]. It uprooted many trees and one mobile home was completely destroyed.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.globalnews.ca/news/4418596/environment-canada-confirms-tornado-touched-down-in-saint-julien |title=Global News Montreal - Environment Canada confirms tornado touched down in Saint-Julien|last=|first=|date=|work=August 30, 2018|access-date=August 30, 2018}}</ref> *September 11 - A probable [[landspout]] tornado was reported near [[Nanton, Alberta]].<ref>{{cite web |first=Geoff |last=Smith |url=https://lethbridgenewsnow.com/article/617416/tornado-spotted-near-nanton-central-northern-alberta-braces-snow |title=Tornado spotted near Nanton as central, northern Alberta braces for snow |date=2018-09-12 |publisher=Lethbridge News Now}}</ref> *September 21 - [[2018 Ottawa–Gatineau tornadoes|Three tornadoes]] were confirmed in [[Eastern Ontario]] causing extensive damage. The first, an EF1, developed over [[Calabogie, Ontario|Calibogie]] and tracked to [[White Lake, Ontario|White Lake]]. Several houses sustained roof damage and trees were snapped and uprooted. The second tornado touched down in the city of [[Ottawa, Ontario|Ottawa]] and was given a high end EF3 rating. It developed {{convert|10|km|abbr=on}} west of [[Kinburn, Carleton County, Ontario|Kinburn]], tracked through [[Dunrobin, Ontario|Dunrobin]], then crossed the [[Ottawa River]] and continued through [[Gatineau, Quebec]]. It tossed cars, snapped trees and destroyed or severely damaged dozens of homes. The third tornado, an EF2, hit the [[Trend-Arlington|Arlington Woods]] area of [[Ottawa, Ontario|Ottawa]], snapping hydro poles and damaging trees and buildings. All together at least 25 people were injured, 6 seriously. The EF3 tornado is only the second with that rating to touch down in [[Canada]] in September or later.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/gatineau-ottawa-dunrobin-tornado-storm/112859/|title=The Weather Network - CONFIRMED: Three tornadoes, two downbursts hit Ottawa region|last=|first=|date=|work=September 24, 2018|access-date=September 24, 2018}}</ref> *September 21 - [[Environment and Climate Change Canada]] confirmed three EF1 tornadoes touched down in [[Quebec]], associated with the tornado outbreak in [[Ontario]] the same day. The first touched down near the [[Val-des-Bois, Quebec|Val-des-Bois]] area, leaving a {{convert|13|km|abbr=on}} path of snapped trees and damaged buildings. The second occurred near the [[Baskatong Reservoir]], about {{convert|30|km|abbr=on}} east of [[Mont-Laurier, Quebec|Mont-Laurier]] in a heavily wooded area. Satellite pictures showed damage to trees and power lines. The third tornado touched down {{convert|25|km|abbr=on}} north of [[Otter Lake, Quebec|Otter Lake]] leaving a {{convert|3|km|abbr=on}} path through woodlands.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/tornadoes-ottawa-quebec-1.4838130|title=CBC News - 6 tornadoes hit Ottawa-Gatineau region, Environment Canada says|last=|first=|date=|work=September 25, 2018|access-date=September 25, 2018}}</ref> *September 25 - Three tornadoes touched down in extreme [[Southwestern Ontario]], near [[Windsor, Ontario|Windsor]], after tornado warned storms swept through the region. [[Environment and Climate Change Canada]] (ECCC) confirmed a probable EF0 tornado hit first near [[Amherstburg, Ontario|Amherstburg]] where a brick welcome sign was blown over and large tree branches were snapped. There was no evidence of a long and narrow path of damage, but it was in line with the damage path of a tornado that occurred earlier that day in Michigan. The other two tornadoes were given EF1 ratings and touched down near the towns of [[McGregor, Ontario|McGregor]] and Staples. Both twisters caused roof and building damage and downed trees along a {{convert|3|km|abbr=on}} path that was approximately 50 metres wide. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theweathernetwork.com/news/articles/tornadoes-confirmed-southwestern-ontario-mcgregor-staples-amherstburg-damage-downed-trees-september-25/113322|title=The Weather Network - Three tornadoes confirmed in Ontario amid last week's storms|last=|first=|date=|work=October 1, 2018|access-date=October 1, 2018}}</ref>

This is a selected list of international [[academic conference]]s in the fields of [[distributed computing]], [[parallel computing]], and [[concurrent computing]].
== Selection criteria ==
The conferences listed here are major conferences of the area; they have been selected using the following criteria:- # the notability of the conference has been confirmed by multiple independent sources; for example, it has been mentioned in textbooks<ref name="lynch">[[Nancy Lynch|Nancy Ann Lynch]]: ''Distributed Algorithms'', Morgan Kaufmann, 1996, {{ISBN|978-1-55860-348-6}}. Section 1.4, "Bibliographic notes", mentions the following conferences: PODC, FOCS, STOC, SPAA, WDAG.</ref><ref name="tel">Gerard Tel: ''Introduction to Distributed Algorithms'', 2nd ed., Cambridge University Press, 2000, {{ISBN|978-0-521-79483-1}}. Sect. 1.3.3, "Research field", mentions the following conferences: PODC, WDAG/DISC, STOC, FOCS.</ref><ref name="georgiou">Chryssis Georgiou, Alexander A. Shvartsman: ''Do-All Computing in Distributed Systems: Cooperation in the Presence of Adversity'', Springer, 2007, {{ISBN|978-0-387-30918-7}}. Section "Bibliographic notes" in "Preface" mentions the following conferences: PODC, SPAA, STOC, SODA, FOCS, ICDCS, DISC, OPODIS, SIROCCO.</ref> or other sources,<ref name="podc-mailinglist">[[Symposium on Principles of Distributed Computing|PODC]] [http://www.podc.org/podc-mailinglist.txt mailing list instructions] mention the following conferences (in addition to PODC): DISC, ICDCN, ICDCS, OPODIS, PPoPP, SIROCCO, SPAA, SSS.</ref><ref name="wattenhofer">Roger Wattenhofer: [http://dcg.ethz.ch/publications/podc07.pdf PODC 2007 Statistics]. The following conferences are listed as other conferences where PODC authors have published most, during the last 5 years: DISC, OPODIS, SPAA, SIROCCO, ICDCS, SRDS, STOC, SODA, FOCS, ESA.</ref> or it has received a high ranking<ref name="core">The [http://www.core.edu.au/rankings/Conference%20Ranking%20Main.html 2007 Australian Ranking of ICT Conferences] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091002002344/http://www.core.edu.au/rankings/Conference%20Ranking%20Main.html |date=2009-10-02 }}. In this ranking, the [http://www.core.edu.au/rankings/conf-tiers.pdf tiers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080718233742/http://www.core.edu.au/rankings/conf-tiers.pdf |date=2008-07-18 }} are A+ ("... one of the very best in its field or subfield..."), A ("... would add to the author's respect..."), B ("... some confidence that research was done..."), L ("... local conferences..."), and C (the rest). Conferences on the tier A+ include PODC. Conferences on the tier A include the following: CONCUR, DISC, EuroPar, HiPC, HPDC, ICDCS, ICPP, ICS, IPDPS, MassPar, NDSS, PACT, PADS, P2P, PPoPP, PPSN, SPAA, SRDS, SUPER.</ref> # the conference focuses on distributed and parallel computing (instead of having a much broader scope such as algorithms in general) # the conference covers a reasonably large part of the fields of distributed and parallel computing (instead of focusing on a narrow sub-topic). For the first criterion, references are provided; criteria 2–3 are usually clear from the name of the conference.
== Conferences ==
* '''DISC''' — [[International Symposium on Distributed Computing]]<ref name="lynch"/><ref name="tel"/><ref name="georgiou"/><ref name="podc-mailinglist"/><ref name="wattenhofer"/><ref name="core"/> ** formerly: WDAG — Workshop on Distributed Algorithms on Graphs ** organized in cooperation with the [[European Association for Theoretical Computer Science]] (EATCS) * '''ICDCS''' — [[International Conference on Distributed Computing Systems]]<ref name="georgiou" /><ref name="podc-mailinglist" /><ref name="wattenhofer" /><ref name="core" /><ref name="zaiane-dp" /> ** sponsored by [[IEEE Computer Society]] Technical Committee on Distributed Processing (TCDP) ** organized in 1979, 1981, 1983, and annually since 1984 * '''ICPADS''' — [[International Conference on Parallel and Distributed Systems]]<ref name="core" /><ref name="zaiane-dp">In this ranking, the [http://webdocs.cs.ualberta.ca/~zaiane/htmldocs/ConfRanking.html tiers] Conferences on Top Tier include PPoPP, and the Second Tier include PODC SPAA ICDCS ICPADS CCC.</ref> ** sponsored by [[IEEE Computer Society]] Technical Committee on Distributed Processing (TCDP) and Technical Committee on Parallel Processing (TCPP) ** organized in 1992 * '''IPDPS''' — [[International Parallel and Distributed Processing Symposium]] ** organized annually since 1987, next edition: 21-25 May. 2018, Vancouver, Canada ** sponsored by [[IEEE Computer Society]] Technical Committee on Distributed Processing (TCDP) and Technical Committee on Parallel Processing (TCPP) ** proceedings published by [[IEEE]] * '''OPODIS''' — [[International Conference on Principles of Distributed Systems]]<ref name="georgiou" /><ref name="podc-mailinglist" /><ref name="wattenhofer" /> ** proceedings published by [[Springer Science+Business Media|Springer]] in the [[Lecture Notes in Computer Science|LNCS]] series ** organized annually since 1997 * '''PODC''' — ACM [[Symposium on Principles of Distributed Computing]]<ref name="lynch" /><ref name="tel" /><ref name="georgiou" /><ref name="core" /><ref name="zaiane-dp" /> ** sponsored by the [[Association for Computing Machinery|ACM]] special interest groups [[ACM SIGACT|SIGACT]] and [[ACM SIGOPS|SIGOPS]] ** organized annually since 1982 * '''PPoPP''' — ACM SIGPLAN [[Symposium on Principles and Practice of Parallel Programming]]<ref name="podc-mailinglist" /><ref name="core" /><ref name="zaiane-dp" /> ** sponsored by the [[Association for Computing Machinery|ACM]] special interest group [[ACM SIGPLAN|SIGPLAN]] ** organised in 1988 and 1990; biennially in 1991–2005; and annually since 2006 * '''SIROCCO''' — [[International Colloquium on Structural Information and Communication Complexity]]<ref name="georgiou" /><ref name="podc-mailinglist" /><ref name="wattenhofer" /> ** proceedings published by [[Springer Science+Business Media|Springer]] in the [[Lecture Notes in Computer Science|LNCS]] series ** organized annually since 1994 * '''SPAA''' — ACM [[Symposium on Parallelism in Algorithms and Architectures]]<ref name="lynch" /><ref name="georgiou" /><ref name="podc-mailinglist" /><ref name="wattenhofer" /><ref name="core" /><ref name="zaiane-dp" /> ** formerly: ACM Symposium on Parallel Algorithms and Architectures ** sponsored by the [[Association for Computing Machinery|ACM]] special interest groups [[ACM SIGACT|SIGACT]] and [[ACM SIGARCH|SIGARCH]], organized in cooperation with the [[European Association for Theoretical Computer Science]] (EATCS) ** organized annually since 1989
